sentences.literal: Bai Qi was a native of Mei.
He was skilled in the art of war and served King Zhao of Qin.

sentences.chinese: 是歲，穰侯相秦，舉任鄙以為漢中守。
sentences.literal: That year, the Marquis of Rang served as Qin's prime minister and appointed Ren Bi as governor of Hanzhong.
Qi was promoted to state defender.

sentences.chinese: 涉河取韓安邑以東，到乾河。
sentences.literal: He crossed the Yellow River and took Han's Anyi and eastward to Ganhe.
The next year, Bai Qi became grand master craftsman.

sentences.chinese: 攻魏，拔之，取城小大六十一。
sentences.literal: He attacked Wei, conquered it, and took sixty-one cities of varying sizes.

sentences.chinese: 明年，起與客卿錯攻垣城，拔之。
sentences.literal: The next year, Qi and guest minister Cuo attacked Yuan City and conquered it.

sentences.chinese: 後五年，白起攻趙，拔光狼城。
sentences.literal: Five years later, Bai Qi attacked Zhao and conquered Guanglang City.

sentences.chinese: 後七年，白起攻楚，拔鄢、鄧五城。
sentences.literal: Seven years later, Bai Qi attacked Chu and conquered Yan and Deng—five cities in total.

sentences.chinese: 其明年，攻楚，拔郢，燒夷陵，遂東至竟陵。
sentences.literal: The next year, he attacked Chu again, conquered Ying, burned Yiling, and advanced east to Jingling.
The King of Chu fled Ying and moved east to Chen.
Qin made Ying into Nanhun Commandery.
Bai Qi was promoted to Lord Wu'an.

sentences.chinese: 武安君因取楚，定巫、黔中郡。
sentences.literal: Lord Wu'an then conquered Chu and established the commanderies of Wu and Qianzhong.
